rlsDevHandle_t rlsCommOpen ( unsigned char  deviceIndex,
unsigned int  flags 
)

This function opens and initialize all the FTDI ports.

Parameters
[in]deviceIndex- Index of the device for which the FTDI ports needs to be initialized
[in]flags- UNUSED
Returns
rlsDevHandle_t Success - Device handle for the initialized FTDI interface Failure - NULL

◆ rlsDeviceWaitIrqStatus()

int rlsDeviceWaitIrqStatus ( rlsDevHandle_t  hdl,
unsigned char  level 
)

This function waits until the Host IRQ pin level matches the specified level.

Parameters
[in]hdl- handle for the device for which the specified Host IRQ state needs to be confirmed
[in]level- Host IRQ pin Level should match this value for the function to return
Returns
int Success - RLS_RET_CODE_OK, Failure - RLS_RET_CODE_COMM_RD_ERROR

Definition at line 1659 of file mmwl_port_ftdi.c.

◆ rlsI2CRead()

int rlsI2CRead ( rlsDevHandle_t  hdl,
unsigned char  slaveAddress,
unsigned char  regAddress,
unsigned char *  msbData,
unsigned char *  lsbData,
int  datasize 
)

This function writes to the salve through I2C protocol.

Parameters
[in]hdl- pointer to the handle
[in]slaveAddress- I2C address of the slave
[in]regAddress- Register address in the slave
[in]msbData- MSB of the data written
[in]lsbData- LSB of the data written
[in]datasize- Number of bytes of Data to be read
Returns
int Success - 0, Failure - Error Code

◆ rlsRegisterInterruptHandler()

int rlsRegisterInterruptHandler ( unsigned char  deviceIndex,
RLS_P_EVENT_HANDLER  fpInterruptHdl,
void *  pValue 
)

This function register the interrupt handler with mmwavelink for the device having the specified device index.

Parameters
[in]deviceIndex- Index of the device for which the interrupt needs to be registered
[in]fpInterruptHdl- Function pointer to be registered as interrupt handler
[in]pValue- pointer to the value which will be passed as an argument to the registered function
Returns
int Success - RLS_RET_CODE_OK, Failure - RLS_RET_CODE_NULL_PTR_ERROR

Definition at line 1587 of file mmwl_port_ftdi.c.
